newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-RHODES AND KALLIS NAMED IN ONE-DAY SQUAD.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RHODES AND KALLIS NAMED IN ONE-DAY SQUAD.

text.p: Jonty Rhodes and Jacques Kallis make a return to the international scene with their inclusion in South Africa's squad of 14 for the triangular limited overs series against India and Zimbabwe.
Rhodes has been out of favour since his early return from South Africa's recent tour to India because of injury.
However, he has been in fine form for Natal, scoring consecutive centuries in the Supersport Series matches against Free State and Eastern Province.
Western Province all-rounder Kallis has completed his rehabilitation from a back injury and will add an extra bowling option to Hansie Cronje's team.
The 11 playing in the final test against India here at the Wanderers have been selected, and the squad is completed by 37-year-old off-spinner Pat Symcox.
Symcox was an integral member of the test and one-day squad in India but has been surplus to requirements on the more seamer-friendly pitches in South Africa.
The first match of the series is between South Africa and India in Bloemfontein on Thursday.

South African squad: Hansie Cronje (captain), Gary Kirsten, Andrew Hudson, Adam Bacher, Daryll Cullinan, Jonty Rhodes, Jacques Kallis, Brian McMillan, Shaun Pollock, Lance Klusener, Dave Richardson, Pat Symcox, Allan Donald, Paul Adams.
